name: New Orleans
description: The cradle of jazz music, New Orleans is a little out of step with the United States when it comes to dining, architecture and just day-to-day living. It’s a city of Creole cottages, palatial townhouses, elegant iron balconies and shaded courtyards. New Orleans is that rare place where you can order a cocktail to-go, and turn a corner and be swept along in a street parade.

thingsToDo.name: French Quarter
thingsToDo.text: Rakish, bohemian and bouncy, the French Quarter (Vieux Carré) is the grand dame, and springs to mind when many people think New Orleans. All the hallmarks are here, like the carnage of Bourbon Street, Creole cottages, wrought-iron balconies, laid-back cafes, pastel facades, gaslights, jazz clubs, flowery courtyards, to-go cups, antique stores and restaurants that have been around for a century or more.

thingsToDo.name: Garden District
thingsToDo.text: New Orleans at its most refined, the Garden District was developed for rich Americans who didn’t want to live in the French Quarter with the Creoles. From the mid-1830s they built themselves theatrical Italianate and Greek Revival mansions, often painted bright white and sporting two tiers of galleries.

thingsToDo.name: Jackson Square
thingsToDo.text: Once a military parade ground at the very centre of the city Jackson Square was first laid out in 1720s in the style of Place des Vosges in Paris. After the Battle of New Orleans in 1815 the plaza was renamed in honour of the victorious General Andrew Jackson who would become the seventh president of the United States between 1829 and 1837. At the very centre of formal gardens is the equestrian statue for Jackson by sculptor Clark Mills and unveiled in 1856.

thingsToDo.name: Mardi Gras
thingsToDo.text: After twelfth night on January 6 New Orleans is officially in Mardi Gras season. Until Fat Tuesday (Shrove Tuesday), usually some time in February, the city is a blur of parades by enormous floats that have been months in the making.

thingsToDo.name: Frenchmen Street
thingsToDo.text: When people talk about Frenchmen Street they normally mean the three-block stretch through Faubourg Marigny that has ascended the throne as the best place for live music in New Orleans.

thingsToDo.name: French Market
thingsToDo.text: Up there with the United States’ great shopping and dining experiences, the French Market is in long iron-framed halls designed in the late-19th century by Joseph Abeilard, one of America’s first African American architects.

thingsToDo.name: Royal Street
thingsToDo.text: Parallel to Bourbon Street as it cuts through the French Quarter, Royal Street is a quieter, maybe more genteel sibling.

name: Baton Rouge
description: Baton Rouge is the capital of the state of Louisiana, and is known for its amazing food scene, historical landmarks, and fun and quirky attractions. Located along the gorgeous banks of the powerhouse Mississippi River, Baton Rouge is known for its stunning river views and strategic location, and whatever your interests, you are sure to find something to enjoy in this city known for its dynamism and diversity.

thingsToDo.name: LSU Museum of Art
thingsToDo.text: Art lovers in Baton Rouge shouldn’t miss the chance to head to the LSU Museum of Art which is housed inside the larger Shaw Center for the Arts and encompasses a rather impressive 13,000 square feet as well as fourteen galleries.

thingsToDo.name: Mike the Tiger Habitat
thingsToDo.text: Mike the Tiger is the official mascot of Louisiana State University, and one of the top things to do in this city is to visit his residence. A tiger has long been used as the mascot of the university, and Mike the Tiger I was first acquired in the 1930s.

thingsToDo.name: Old State Capitol Building
thingsToDo.text: Louisiana’s Old State Capitol Building is one of the most historic buildings in the whole of the state and was the head of the State Legislature from the 1800s through to the 1930s. The location of the building is simply stunning, as it was built on a bluff that offers fantastic views over the Mississippi River and is known for its Gothic design which has made it a local landmark, as well as meaning that it is often mistaken for a castle rather than a state capitol.

thingsToDo.name: Red Stick Farmers Market
thingsToDo.text: If you want to try some of the freshest produce in Baton Rouge then you need to head to the Red Stick Farmers Market which is open every Thursday and Saturday.

thingsToDo.name: Baton Rouge Zoo
thingsToDo.text: Baton Rouge Zoo first opened its doors to the public in 1970 and has been going strong as an animal sanctuary ever since. The zoo now houses almost 2,000 animals and has reptiles, fish, birds, and primates from all over the world.

thingsToDo.name: Louisiana Art & Science Museum
thingsToDo.text: If you are interested in art and science then look no further than the Louisiana Art and Science Museum which has galleries dedicated to both subjects as well as an in-house planetarium.

name: Las Vegas
description: Las Vegas might boast a reputation for round-the-clock partying and dazzling casinos, but Sin City has far more to offer than simply hangovers and roulette! If you’re hunting for fun things to do in Las Vegas, you’ll be spoiled for choice.

thingsToDo.name: Fly Over Las Vegas on Board a Helicopter
thingsToDo.text: Get a chance to jump in a helicopter and fly under the twinkling starlight over the shimmering Las Vegas Strip. Taking to the skies in a chopper is one thing, but seeing Las Vegas illuminated by all its vibrant lights from the sky is another!

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Black Canyon Wildlife by Kayak
thingsToDo.text: One of the most enjoyable things you could do while visiting the Black Canyon is a half-day kayak tour. You’ll get to see the native wildlife, including desert bighorn sheep. The flora is also very impressive, and you’ll get to see a number of beautiful landscapes, such as the Emerald Cave.

thingsToDo.name: Say “I do” in the Graceland Chapel in Front of Elvis
thingsToDo.text: If you’re crazy enough for a spur-of-the-moment wedding, then the Graceland Chapel in Las Vegas awaits. It can be an official or nonofficial wedding – the aim is just to have fun! If you want to spice up the event, you can even have the wedding officiated by Elvis!

thingsToDo.name: Try the Cowboy Lifestyle With a Sunset Dinner After a Horseback Tour
thingsToDo.text: Put yourself into the Wild West with a horseback-seated sunset! Dusk in Nevada is powerful and colorful, and what better way to see it than with a delicious dinner and nothing but nature as far as the eye can see?

thingsToDo.name: Witness the Warm Color Palette of the Valley of Fire
thingsToDo.text: Who said going to Las Vegas was just about gambling? The city is central to many stunning National Parks, including the Valley of Fire. Guided hiking tours pick you up and drop you off from Las Vegas, all you need to do is make sure the camera batteries are charged!

thingsToDo.name: Put on Your Best Poker Face at the Famous Bellagio Hotel
thingsToDo.text: If you are a fan of poker, you will definitely enjoy your stay in Las Vegas. You can play poker in basically every casino you pass by. But if there is one you can’t miss, it’s definitely the Bellagio Hotel. The sheer volume of cash changing hands at the Bellagio’s high-stakes tables are astronomical!

name: Reno
description: When people think of gambling and casinos in the United States, they usually think of Las Vegas. As such Reno is often overlooked, which is great shame for anyone travelling here and missing out on the best that this city has to offer.  Along with the bright lights of the casinos here, there are a wealth of other things to do including walks by the city’s mighty Truckee River, as well as visits to museums, galleries, and zoos. If you venture out of Reno slightly, then you will come to the amazing and iconic Lake Tahoe, worth the trip in its own right, but even within the city limits you can expect to find gems such as Mount Rose as well as parks, botanical gardens, and arboretums.

thingsToDo.name: Lake Tahoe
thingsToDo.text: Lake Tahoe is technically about 40 miles outside of the city of Reno, but it is still on the biggest draws in the area. Located between Nevada and California, Lake Tahoe is known as one of the most beautiful places in the entire United States and visitors flock here from all over the world to see the azure waters of the lake surrounded by majestic mountains.

thingsToDo.name: Mount Rose Ski Resort
thingsToDo.text: For some gorgeous scenery within the boundaries of Reno, look no further than Mount Rose Ski Resort which is only about 20 miles away from the downtown area of this city. Mount Rose stands at over 8,000 feet, and this makes it the highest resort in the Reno/Tahoe area.

thingsToDo.name: Eldorado
thingsToDo.text: The Eldorado is one of the most famous casinos in Reno and is also known as one of the premium spots to gamble here, if you feel like testing your luck while you are in town. The Eldorado first opened its doors in the early 1970s, which means that it has seen a lot of change in Reno over the years, and it still has a kind of period charm to this day.

thingsToDo.name: Riverwalk
thingsToDo.text: Snaking alongside the Truckee River in the downtown area of Reno is the Riverwalk. Here you will find a plethora of cultural activities on offer, and this area is particularly well known for its art galleries and restaurants.

thingsToDo.name: National Automobile Museum
thingsToDo.text: If you are a fan of all things related to automobiles then consider a visit to the National Automobile Museum that has its home in Reno.

thingsToDo.name: Atlantis Casino Resort Spa
thingsToDo.text: Atlantis Casino Resort Spa is one of the best known casinos and luxury hotels in Reno, and was built in 1972, making it something of a stalwart on the casino scene in this city.

name: Amsterdam
description: Amsterdam is a glorious city full of markets, museums, and great restaurants and bars. Its majestic canals are lined with 17th-century houses and buildings full of history. While the canal ring is home to some of the most popular attractions, new urban parks and developments outside the historic core mean there are fun, less-crowded places to explore, too.

thingsToDo.name: Feel The Royalty At The Royal Palace
thingsToDo.text: The Royal Palace in Amsterdam is a very interesting site to visit. Even if you are just one day in Amsterdam, it is worth seeing it! It is located at Dam Square and it is a very impressive building. The architecture is amazing and really stands out from the other buildings in Amsterdam.

thingsToDo.name: Stroll And Shop Around Dam Square
thingsToDo.text: Dam square is located in the middle of the busy neighborhood Centrum. On one side of it stand the Royal Palace and on the other side, the National Monument – a memorial for WWII. The streets going out of the square to the north and south are the place for strolling between stores, restaurants and fast food, and tourist attractions.

thingsToDo.name: Visit The Anne Frank House
thingsToDo.text: Even though you might associate Amsterdam with parties and fun, a top activity in the city is a heartbreaking one. Visiting the house where a little Jewish girl and her family went into hiding during World War II is a must to gain perspective about the painful past of the city. Walk through the halls of this biographical museum, where Anne’s famous Diary was written. Although it’s an incredibly sad experience, it’s also inspiring to see how something beautiful came from such a tragedy. Photography is prohibited at the museum. So put your phone away during your visit and immerse yourself in her freedomless world.

thingsToDo.name: Stroll Around Vondelpark
thingsToDo.text: One of the top sites in Amsterdam is Vondelpark, as seen in this Amsterdam Itinerary.  The most famous park in the Netherlands, Vondelpark is 120 acres of landscaped grounds in the middle of the city. This park first opened in 1865, and now over a century and a half later is as popular as ever.

thingsToDo.name: Explore The City Through The Canals
thingsToDo.text: Amsterdam’s unique location on the water means that a boat tour is an absolute must-do in this incredible city. With over 100 kilometers of canals, the so-called Grachten, Amsterdam can be explored from the water while seated comfortably. If you’re traveling with children this is a great way to avoid having to walk long distances while still getting to see many of the attractions that make this city so famous.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Rijksmuseum
thingsToDo.text: The Rijksmuseum is in an impressive 19th-century building on Museum Square (Museumplein). The square is surrounded by four museums and is often filled with open-air exhibitions. The Rijksmuseum is the largest and most popular museum in the Netherlands. It is dedicated to the country’s art and history covering 800 years from 1200 to 2000.

name: Rotterdam
description: Rotterdam is located in the southern Netherlands and is the second largest city in the country after the capital Amsterdam with a population of approximately 630,000. Rotterdam has been a major city for many hundreds of years and has always served as a large port as it lies on the Rhine-Meuse-Scheldt river delta.

thingsToDo.name: Markthal Rotterdam
thingsToDo.text: The Markthal is a stunning piece of architecture that was constructed in 2009 and serves as both an office building and a marketplace. The design of the structure is quite unique with a large semi-circular grey façade and a large windowed section facing out to the surrounding courtyard. The inside of the structure has some amazing artwork by Arno Coenen and shows various colourful fruits, plants, insects and flowers.

thingsToDo.name: Rotterdam Zoo
thingsToDo.text: Also known as the Diergaarde Blijdorp, the Rotterdam Zoo had stood for many years despite having to change locations during WWII to avoid bombing. The zoo is in great condition and features a Botanical garden and Oceanium and also operates breeding programs to help endangered species such as the Red Panda.

thingsToDo.name: Euromast Tower
thingsToDo.text: The Euromast Tower is an observation station that was created in 1960 to provide panoramic views of the Rotterdam Cityscape. The towers stands at 606ft and with its antenna it is the tallest building in Rotterdam. The tower features a restaurant, a conference room for business meetings, a hotel suite and of course the observation deck.

thingsToDo.name: Erasmus Bridge
thingsToDo.text: This monumental bridge spans the Nieuwe Maas distributary of the Rhine and runs from the confluence of the Noord and Lek rivers. The length of this impressive bridge stretches to an immense 802m making it the second largest in the Netherlands. The bridge is nicknamed the Swan due to its large upright mast that resembles the neck of a swan.

thingsToDo.name: Rotterdam Central Station
thingsToDo.text: Rotterdam is a city that is full of modern and unique architecture and the central station is one such building. The new terminal was opened in 2014 and its architecture has become quite iconic. The building has a triangular shape that points towards the sky at a protruding angle.

thingsToDo.name: Maritime Museum
thingsToDo.text: The Maritime Museum is one of the largest of its type in the world with a huge collection of cartography, maritime memorabilia and art. The museum is located in central Rotterdam near the Markthal and the Cube houses.

name: Utrecht
description: Utrecht is the fourth largest city in the Netherlands and serves as the capital of the Utrecht province in the centre of the country around 25 minutes south of Amsterdam. The city is an important religious centre in the Netherlands and has many historical churches and architecture dating as far back as the middle ages.

thingsToDo.name: The Dom Tower of Utrecht
thingsToDo.text: This huge structure towers above the city and is one of Utrecht’s most iconic landmarks.

thingsToDo.name: Railway Museum
thingsToDo.text: This fascinating railway museum is actually housed in one of Utrecht’s old railway stations and is located in the eastern part of the town.

thingsToDo.name: Utrecht Canals
thingsToDo.text: Amsterdam is not the only city in the Netherlands to have a canal network – Utrecht has an extensive system of canals, most of which are lined with traditional houses and provide a beautiful area to walk through.

thingsToDo.name: Centraal Museum
thingsToDo.text: This is the main museum in Utrecht and was originally established in 1838. The museum features an impressive collection of artworks mainly from well-known local artists such as Joachim Wtewael and Gerard Van Honthorst.

thingsToDo.name: St Martin’s Cathedral
thingsToDo.text: St. Martin’s is the main Cathedral in Utrecht and was once connected to the Dom Tower, however the nave collapsed and the two building have been separate ever since.

thingsToDo.name: Museum Speelklok
thingsToDo.text: The clock museum is a magical place full of entertainment and wondrous pieces that will delight people of all ages.

thingsToDo.name: Utrecht Botanical Gardens
thingsToDo.text: The famous Botanical Gardens are located in the University of Utrecht in the eastern part of the town just off of the A28 road.

name: Barcelona
description: Pass through thousands of years of history as you explore Barcelona’s ancient Roman walls, its Gothic quarter, and its modern Gaudì masterpieces, including the Sagrada Família and Casa Batlló. Bask beside the Mediterranean by day, and by night enjoy paella and tapas at a seaside bar. Walk down Las Ramblas for people-watching and shopping.

thingsToDo.name: See Nature Written in Stone in Gaudì’s Masterpieces
thingsToDo.text: Barcelona is home to some of Gaudì’s most famous masterpieces, including the Sagrada Família and the Casa Batlló, works which blend Gaudì’s interest in architecture and natural forms.

thingsToDo.name: See Picasso’s Formative Works
thingsToDo.text: Picasso spent his early years in Barcelona; see works of art that span Picasso’s career at the impressive Museu Picasso.

thingsToDo.name: Eat Your Way Through Barcelona
thingsToDo.text: From Pintxos (Basque tapas) to beautiful paellas, Barcelona is a city of culinary masterpieces.

thingsToDo.name: Soak in the Mediterranean Sun at Barceloneta Beach
thingsToDo.text: The sea is never far away from Barcelona’s historic center; Barceloneta Beach offers people-watching, amenities, and proximity to the Gothic Quarter.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Gothic Quarter
thingsToDo.text: Barcelona’s history goes back to Roman times; get a glimpse of the past while wandering the old quarter’s ancient cobblestone streets.

name: Madrid
description: Madrid is known for its vibrant culinary scene, its bustling city squares, its beautiful parks, and legendary Prado Museum. Spend a day in Madrid strolling the Parque del Buen Retiro. Visit Plaza Mayor to sample an Iberian ham bocadillo, and then browse the shops at Las Salinas. Set aside a day or two for the Prado Museum with its stunning collection that spans the eras.

thingsToDo.name: Meet the Masters at the Prado
thingsToDo.text: Must-see paintings at this world-renowned museum include “Las Meninas” by Velázquez, Goya’s “The Third of May,” Hieronymus Bosch’s “Garden of Earthly Delights,” and van der Weyden’s “Descent from the Cross.”

thingsToDo.name: Marvelous Markets
thingsToDo.text: Search for hidden treasures at the El Rastro flea market, browse the local produce at the Mercado San Miguel, wander the shops of the Puerta del Sol, or stroll down the Gran Vía.

thingsToDo.name: Find Your Park
thingsToDo.text: Retiro Park is known for its gardens, which includes a beautiful rose garden; the Casa de Campo rents kayaks at its lake.

thingsToDo.name: Soak in the Ambiance of Plaza Mayor
thingsToDo.text: From cafés to street performers, Plaza Mayor brings together people, food, and fun.

thingsToDo.name: Savor the Culinary Scene
thingsToDo.text: Madrid is home to Michelin-starred restaurants, charming cafés serving chocolate-drizzled churros, hearty stews, and markets selling Iberian ham.

name: Athens
description: Welcome to Athens, a modern metropolis with a glorious past. From fancy restaurants and traditional tavernas, to magnificent museums and historical sites, you’ll find a blend of the new and the old almost everywhere you go. Crowning the city are the majestic, marbled columns of the Acropolis, reminding the world of its role as the birthplace of democracy and Western civilization. Whether you choose to explore its historic past, enjoy its vibrant nightlife, or soak in the charm of this Greek capital, Liberty Travel can customize a vacation with authentic experiences just for you.

thingsToDo.name: Witness the Acropolis
thingsToDo.text: Perched above the Greek capital, the Acropolis with its Parthenon temple is a reminder of the glory of ancient Athens... and a sight to behold.

thingsToDo.name: Take a guided tour of the Acropolis Museum
thingsToDo.text: This dazzling modern museum showcases ancient archaeological treasures unearthed on the Acropolis dating back to 5th century BC.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Temple of Olympian Zeus
thingsToDo.text: Dedicated to the Olympian god, this colossal temple at the center of Athens featured 104 majestic Corinthian columns of which 15 remain standing.

thingsToDo.name: See the changing of the guards
thingsToDo.text: An exciting and memorable experience, the changing of the Presidential Guards takes place in Syntagma Square daily.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Plaka Quarter
thingsToDo.text: This historic area has a charming village ambience with narrow pedestrian streets, cheerful squares, and authentic cafés and tavernas.

name: Mykonos
description: One of the smallest Greek Cyclades islands, Mykonos is fast becoming one of the most glamorous destinations in the world. This beautiful island is all about enjoying the good life. Couture shops, swanky restaurants, upscale clubs, golden sandy beaches, and a plethora of land and water activities ensure there’s never a dull moment by day or night. Add to it breathtaking mountainous landscape, clear waters, turquoise skies, and whitewashed alleyways, and you have an amazing vacation destination.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Little Venice
thingsToDo.text: Bright-colored Venetian houses with wooden porches and balconies line the seafront with restaurants, bars, shops, and nightclubs.

thingsToDo.name: Check out the windmills
thingsToDo.text: Dating back to the 16th century, these 16 iconic windmills were once used by islanders to grind grain using wind power. Today, they offer great views and photo ops.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the Panagia Paraportiani
thingsToDo.text: The most photographed monument on the island, it’s four little churches that look like one. Visit it at sunset for best views.

thingsToDo.name: Take a day trip to Delos
thingsToDo.text: A shrine of Apollo and a trading center of the early Greeks and Romans, Delos is part of the World Cultural Heritage and protected by UNESCO.

thingsToDo.name: Enjoy the glamour
thingsToDo.text: Famous for its vibrant nightlife and gorgeous beaches, enjoy the island and its many activities by day and night.

name: Santorini
description: A bucket-list destination for many, Santorini lives up to the hype. This crescent-shaped volcanic island is one of the most popular in the Greek Cyclades. Famous for its pristine beaches, crystal-blue sea, iconic caldera views, whitewashed cliff-side homes and stunning sunsets, Santorini is indeed a scenic marvel in the Aegean Sea.

thingsToDo.name: Head up to the capital, Fira
thingsToDo.text: Perched on the cliffs above the caldera, Firá can be reached either by walking, riding mules, or by taking the cable-car.

thingsToDo.name: See a Santorini sunset
thingsToDo.text: Grab a seat and witness a truly surreal sunset with stunning views from several cliff-side vantage points at the picture-perfect village of Oia.

thingsToDo.name: Marvel at the Caldera
thingsToDo.text: Take a tour of this sea-filled volcanic crater formed by a massive volcanic explosion some 3,600 years ago.

thingsToDo.name: Take a Catamaran tour
thingsToDo.text: Discover Santorini's beautiful coastline on this delightful cruise. Explore secluded volcanic beaches, experience the hot springs, or simply relax on deck.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Akrotíri Archaeological Site
thingsToDo.text: Explore this ancient settlement that was buried below the lava following the 16th-century BC volcanic explosion.

name: Vienna
description: Whether you want to see the Bruegel masterpieces at the Museum of Fine Arts, listen to Mozart at the Vienna State Opera, or delve into Vienna’s culinary scene at the Naschmarkt, our vacation consultant can match you with a Vienna vacation package that’s just your style. Explore this city of palaces with a local guide or enjoy one of our insider experiences at a neighborhood tavern.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Schonbrunn Palace
thingsToDo.text: Standing since the 1600’s and holding a major role of cultural importance in Austria, the Schonbrunn Palace is a colossal 1441 room structure and complex that is the main tourist attraction in Vienna. Inside the palace are an assortment of rooms all fully furnished and decorated in the original style – You can enjoy a tour through the rooms and admire the sumptuous furnishings and see how Austrian royalty lived.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the St Stephen’s Cathedral
thingsToDo.text: This monolithic structure stands proud in the Stephensplatz and has been the most important church in Vienna and Austria since its construction. As an iconic building of Vienna, St Stephens cannot be missed!

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Schonbrunn Gardens
thingsToDo.text: Another exceptional part to the Schonbrunn Palace Complex and worthy of a separate visit in its own right, the gardens at Schonbrunn are simply magical. The crowning glory to all of this is the Gloriette which stands opposite the palace and features a pool and a classical colonnaded long building – Enjoy a drink here in the cafe or simple admire the views of the whole gardens in front of you.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Vienna Natural History Museum
thingsToDo.text: Housed in a sophisticated palace complex that is typical of the historical architecture in Vienna, the Natural History Museum has a huge collection of minerals, precious stones, meteorites, fossils, skeletons of animals, displays of various insects and mammals and even some taxidermy of extinct species. Adults and children alike will love the sheer amount of information and eye-boggling displays in this epic museum.

name: Salzburg
description: Situated in central Austria, near the German border, Salzburg is probably best known as the birthplace of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. Travelers come to Austria’s fourth-largest city to view the sights that inspired such unforgettable music. With its hill-topped medieval fortress, picturesque Altstadt old town and breath-taking Alpine scenery, Salzburg’s beauty is sure to enchant visitors in every season of the year.

thingsToDo.name: See the Hoheensalzburg Fortress
thingsToDo.text: Wander around the medieval rooms and courtyard, enjoy panoramic views of the city spread out below, and see the Prince’s Chambers which is one of Europe’s most well-preserved secular Gothic buildings.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Mozart's birtplace
thingsToDo.text: It’s hard to miss the building’s bright yellow façade in the town centre, which is now home to a museum dedicated to the famous composer and one of the most popular Salzburg attractions. Walk through what used to be his family’s apartment, admire his musical instruments, and see other memorabilia dating back to the 18th century.

thingsToDo.name: See the Salzburg Cathedral
thingsToDo.text: Salzburg Cathedral (Dom zu Salzburg) is one of the city’s most beautiful landmarks and found in the historic centre. Dating back centuries, the whitewashed, baroque building features a crypt, seven bells, a baptismal font where famous composers where baptized, and even graffiti that’s about 400 years old.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Hellbrunn Palace
thingsToDo.text: Take a boat ride over to Hellbrunn Palace, the cheery, sunshine-yellow castle best known for its trick fountains. This ‘pleasure palace’ (get your mind out of the gutter!) was built in 1615 as a holiday spot, and the local archbishops loved wandering through the gardens to see the water features, geysers and grottos.

name: Zell am See
description: Tucked away in an idyllic valley among the majestic Kitzbuhel Alps, the alpine city of Zell am See is as picture-perfect as they come. The small city is set on the shores of a vividly blue lake, from which it draws its name, with cosy chalets and flower-filled meadows coating the slopes.

thingsToDo.name: Stay at a cottage overlooking the lake
thingsToDo.text: The lake with the same name as the village, Zeller See, has an area of about 5 square kilometers and is surrounded by chic chalets and the high peaks of the Alps. The view is fabulous at all times, so it would be a shame not to enjoy it right from your room window.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the lake on a boat or water bike
thingsToDo.text: 5 km of water, swans, boats, colorful cabins, greenery and the snowy ridges of the mountains. That’s what the beautiful lake near the village of Zell am See, the one you can explore long and wide, both on the shore and on the water, looks like.

thingsToDo.name: Ride the Alpine Coaster
thingsToDo.text: Well, probably not even a serious ski session will give you the strong feelings you will feel when riding the roller coaster in Kaprun, the village neighboring Zell am See. In figures, it would translate to 730 meters to the top, 1300 meters back to the base and 40 km/h maximum speed. The good part is that the speed depends entirely on you, as you will have a lever to control it throughout the route.

thingsToDo.name: Go hiking
thingsToDo.text: There are several walking and hiking tours, the most popular being Pinzgauer Spaziergang, 19 kilometers long. Starts in Zell am See and ends in Saalbach.

name: Paris
description: With so many gorgeous things to do in Paris, it’s no wonder that the French capital is on the top of so many people’s bucket lists. Some of the must-do unique experiences in Paris include photographing the Eiffel Tower, exploring the Louvre, admiring the stunning Notre Dame, and seeing the world-famous cabaret at the Moulin Rouge, but there’s much more!

thingsToDo.name: Admire the Exterior of Beautiful Notre Dame
thingsToDo.text: Notre Dame Cathedral is and will always be the beating heart of Paris. Despite the devastating fire in April 2019, which destroyed part of the cathedral, a visit to Notre Dame is still one of the most iconic places in Paris for tourists to visit.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Iconic Artworks at the Louvre
thingsToDo.text: From the Royal Palace to the world’s most visited museum in the world, you cannot miss the Louvre, one of the most iconic sites in Paris!

thingsToDo.name: Walk through the Tuileries Gardens
thingsToDo.text: Either before or after you visit the Louvre, be sure to stop by the nearby Tuileries Gardens. This is a lovely place to relax with friends and family or to explore the beautiful gardens, particularly in spring and summer when the flowers are in full bloom.

name: Nice
description: Nice’s unofficial anthem is Nissa La Bella, and you can’t help but agree with this sentiment when you visit the French Riviera’s largest city.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Promenade des Anglais
thingsToDo.text: There are seaside walks, and then there’s the Promenade des Anglais, which is more than just a grand walkway next to the Mediterranean: It’s been an integral part of Nice city life (something the recent attack won’t change) since this embankment was built in the 1820s.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Vieille Ville
thingsToDo.text: The oldest part of the city is a change from Nice’s broad boulevards and expansive squares like Place Masséna.

thingsToDo.name: Try the food
thingsToDo.text: This one city has contributed a lot to French cuisine, and there are a handful of local dishes you can’t leave Nice without trying.

name: Marseille
description: Marseille is one of the top places to visit in Southern France. The capital of Provence (and pastis!) boasts an interesting cultural scene, beautiful landmarks, and 300 days of sunshine.

thingsToDo.name: See the Basilica Notre Dame de la Garde
thingsToDo.text: This impressive stripped building with the perfect setting on the top of the Garde Hill represents one of the most iconic views of Marseille together with the Old Port.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Marseille’s Old Port
thingsToDo.text: The Old Port is Marseille’s beating heart, the city’s main gate to the Mediterranean Sea and the far East. In the 19th century, all the commercial port activities were moved further north, and today the Old Port is a lively picturesque marina and a popular gathering place amongst locals.

thingsToDo.name: See the Cathédrale La Major
thingsToDo.text: Marseille’s Cathedral ‘La Major’ is the main religious building in the city. One of the top things to see in Marseille, the cathedral is located in the historic neighborhood of Le Panier, not far from the MuCEM.

name: Rome
description: Italy’s vibrant capital has all the evidence of once being the Caput Mundi or capital of the world. From the Roman Forum and the Colosseum, to the Pantheon, these ancient sites intertwine effortlessly with present-day Rome. In addition to marveling at the relics of the golden age, lap up the current dolce vita lifestyle.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Colosseum
thingsToDo.text: Take a guided tour of the great arena of gladiators and travel back to the time when man and beast were made to battle for entertainment.

thingsToDo.name: Take a priority tour of Vatican City
thingsToDo.text: Avoid the long lines and enter the Sistine Chapel as a VIP. Admire Michelangelo's masterpiece at your own pace with an audio guided tour.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Roman Forum
thingsToDo.text: Step back two millennia into what was the center of ancient Roman religious and political life, now in the middle of modern Rome.

name: Milan
description: From historic attractions, like The Last Supper painting, the world’s largest Gothic cathedral, and the famous La Scala Opera, to A-list fashion houses like Prada, Versace, and Armani, Milan offers its visitors a blend of the traditional and the ultra-modern. Whether you want to soak in some history at the Duomo; indulge in retail therapy at the Quadrilatero district; take in some culture at the Pinacoteca di Brera, or head to Navigli for a cocktail, we can customize your vacation package with insider insights to experience the best of Milan.

thingsToDo.name: Check out Milan’s Horizon
thingsToDo.text: Ride the elevator to the roof of the Duomo Cathedral. See the sculptures and church spires up-close against Milan’s skyline.

thingsToDo.name: Take a walking food tour
thingsToDo.text: Savor the city’s famous cuisine while walking through the historic district of Brera–where old-world charm meets a youthful downtown vibe.

thingsToDo.name: Take a day trip to Lake Como
thingsToDo.text: Explore the tranquil Lake Como, ringed by beautiful villages, exquisite villas, and snow-peaked Italian Alps.

name: Venice
description: With its spectacular setting and architectural heritage, Venice always enchants. Virtually unchanged for over 600 years, this city on a lagoon is famed for its weathered buildings, picturesque canals, arched bridges, pedestrian streets, soft sunsets and an old-world charm.

thingsToDo.name: Go on a Gondola
thingsToDo.text: See Venice as it was intended to be seen, from the water. Let your gondolier take you through the quiet canals for an enchanting time.

thingsToDo.name: Take a day trip to Burano
thingsToDo.text: Shop for locally-made lace items in this little town of hundreds of colorful houses.

thingsToDo.name: Enjoy Venice by foot
thingsToDo.text: Explore the city’s mysterious past on a night tour through the backstreets.

name: Grand Canyon
description: This massive natural wonder gives Arizona its nickname as The Grand Canyon State, and it's understandable why the attraction is a source of pride for the state. Former President Theodore Roosevelt was right when he said, 'In the Grand Canyon, Arizona has a natural wonder which is in kind absolutely unparalleled throughout the rest of the world.' Travelers can hike or ride mules around the North Rim or raft the Colorado River to explore this national park.

name: Sedona
description: Outdoor enthusiasts flock to this central Arizona town to enjoy its stunning scenery. Regularly described as one of the most beautiful places in America, Sedona dazzles with its famous red rocks and hiking trails (found in Red Rock State Park), as well as its vortexes.

name: Tucson
description: With an average of more than 350 days of sunshine per year, Tucson draws sun-seekers in droves. When you're not lounging by the pool, you can spot native animals like coyotes and prairie dogs at the 98-acre Arizona-Sonora Desert Museum or take a drive along the Mount Lemmon Scenic Byway for stunning photo-ops.

thingsToDo.name: Head for the desert at the Arizona-Sonora Desert Museum
thingsToDo.text: Sprawling over 98 acres and featuring an aquarium, zoo, botanical garden, natural history museum, and art gallery, Arizona-Sonora Desert Museum can be found to the west of Tucson. The museum focuses on educating visitors regarding the various flora and fauna that can be found in the Sonoran Desert region, and houses of 200 species of desert animals and over 1,000 types of plants.

thingsToDo.name: Hike the Sabino Canyon
thingsToDo.text: Located just north of Tucson, the Sabino Canyon is nestled in the Santa Catalina Mountains and the Coronado National Forest. The canyon offers magnificent trails, majestic views, and hiking and trekking opportunities.

thingsToDo.name: Learn all about aerospace at the Pima Air & Space Museum
thingsToDo.text: Proudly known as one of the largest air and space museums in the world, aerospace buffs can see over 300 aircraft and spacecraft at the facility that has a span of over 80 acres.

thingsToDo.name: Star gaze at Kitt Peak National Observatory
thingsToDo.text: For those visitors who want to get closer to the stars, Kitt Peak National Observatory offers the perfect views of the night sky. An astronomical observatory sits atop Kitt Peak in the Quinlan Mountains and boasts the largest and most diverse astronomical equipment in the world that includes 24 telescopes.

name: Phoenix
description: Being one of the most beautiful places in America, Phoenix is a charming capital city of Arizona. Throughout the year, it boasts beaming sun and delightfully warm temperatures, and its expanses of dry desert are among the reasons it is so well-loved.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Arizona Science Center
thingsToDo.text: The Arizona Science Center is a public science museum and is widely considered the greatest in the state, so the fact that it’s in Phoenix – and right close to Heritage Park – makes it a great source of excitement for tourists!

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Camelback Mountain
thingsToDo.text: Camelback Mountain, rising 2,700 feet above the ground, is among the most beautiful and most scenic site seeing and hiking spots in Phoenix.

thingsToDo.name: See the Tovrea Castle
thingsToDo.text: A castle is the last thing you’d expect to find in a desert, but Arizona aims to surprise its visitors every time. Located within easy reach of the Airport Gateway District of Phoenix, the Tovrea Castle was originally a high-end hotel built by Alessio Carraro and his son.

name: Los Angeles
description: Los Angeles draws immigrants and dreamers from across the country and the world, creating a melting pot of cuisines and cultures. Only in LA can world-class cuisine be found hidden in a strip mall restaurant. Visit the city’s world-class museums, follow the stars to the Hollywood Hills, browse the shops on Rodeo Drive, or bask on one of the city’s beaches.

thingsToDo.name: Discover the Art Scene
thingsToDo.text: View contemporary art at the Broad, take in the view and masterpieces at the Getty Center, and discover art that spans the eras at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

thingsToDo.name: Stroll the Hollywood Walk of Fame
thingsToDo.text: While the TCL Chinese Theatre is a tourist hot spot, this famous stretch of sidewalk is iconic.

thingsToDo.name: Bike or Drive Sunset Boulevard
thingsToDo.text: From the gritty clubs of Sunset Strip, the star’s mansions of Bel Air and Beverly Hills, to the shores of Malibu, Sunset Boulevard embodies all that Los Angeles is and all that it aspires to be.

name: San Francisco
description: Take iconic photographs of the Golden Gate Bridge from the park. Ride a cable car down the city’s sweeping hills. Mingle with the tourists at Fisherman’s Wharf and take a ride out to Alcatraz.

thingsToDo.name: Cross the Golden Gate Bridge
thingsToDo.text: Rent a bike or walk across the bridge, or visit Fort Point National Historic Site for the best photo.

thingsToDo.name: Fisherman’s Wharf
thingsToDo.text: Fisherman’s Wharf is a must-see, but it’s bustling with tourists. From here, ride one of the city’s iconic cable cars or take a boat to Alcatraz for a glimpse back in time.

thingsToDo.name: Find Your Neighborhood
thingsToDo.text: The murals of the Mission District, the culture of Chinatown, the history of the Castro, and the innovation of Silicon Valley—San Francisco’s neighborhoods are diverse and vibrant.

name: Palm Springs
description: A lush green oasis in the picturesque California desert, romantic Palm Springs is all about sun-worshipping, unrivaled recreation, world-class spas, spectacular natural landscapes, awesome Mid-Century Modern architecture, great entertainment, and fabulous shopping.

thingsToDo.name: Tour Mid-Century Modern Homes & Buildings
thingsToDo.text: See and learn about hundreds of homes and buildings by extraordinary architects who transformed Palm Springs into the 'New Capital of Cool'.

thingsToDo.name: Spectacular Vistas from Mount San Jacinto
thingsToDo.text: Ride the Palm Springs Aerial Tramway 8,500 feet up to the top of Mount San Jacinto for awesome views.

thingsToDo.name: Hike in Joshua Tree National Park
thingsToDo.text: Home of the distinctive Joshua Tree yucca, this 800,000-acre park in the Mojave Desert encompasses two separate ecosystems at different altitudes.

name: Miami
description: Miami is a city where you can spend your morning working on your tan on South Beach, explore the Art Deco architecture after lunch, and party into the night. Marvel at the blend of Latin American and Caribbean cultural influences, with cuisine to match. Sip a margarita the size of your head while sitting on Ocean Drive, and watch the parade of fashion, bling, and fancy cars. Still, nature is never far away. Miami is surrounded by the sea and the Everglades.

thingsToDo.name: Experience Ocean Drive
thingsToDo.text: From the sparkling shores of South Beach to oversize margaritas and people-watching from the patios of the Art Deco hotels—Ocean Drive is quite an experience.

thingsToDo.name: Hit the club
thingsToDo.text: The Miami party scene spans cultures and genres—from open-air salsa, velvet rope VIP clubs, to electronic dance music, indie rock, and rap clubs. Sip a craft beer over music in Wynwood, or put on your dancing shoes at South Beach.

thingsToDo.name: Eat at Versailles Restaurant in Little Havana
thingsToDo.text: Visit the world’s most renowned Cuban restaurant for a café con leche and an authentic Cuban sandwich.

thingsToDo.name: See the Alligators
thingsToDo.text: Take an airboat ride through Everglades National Park, and meet the alligators and incredible birds that call this wetland home.

name: Orlando
description: Orlando is best known for its glittering theme parks. Meet your favorite characters at the Magic Kingdom, explore the world of tomorrow at Epcot, and journey into the savannah at Disney’s Animal Kingdom. Enter the Wizarding World of Harry Potter at Universal or ride the coasters at Islands of Adventure™. Beyond the thrills of the parks, Orlando is a vibrant city in its own right.

thingsToDo.name: Enter a World of Magic at Walt Disney World
thingsToDo.text: From the Magic Kingdom with Cinderella’s Castle to Animal Kingdom’s wild encounters, there’s something for the kids and for the kids at heart at Walt Disney World.

thingsToDo.name: Splash Around at a Water Park
thingsToDo.text: Play at Disney’s Blizzard Beach and Typhoon Lagoon or enjoy Universal’s Volcano Bay.

thingsToDo.name: See the Ballet or Broadway
thingsToDo.text: Enjoy a change of pace from the theme parks with a ballet or Broadway production at the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts.

name: Key West
description: Key West is quirky, charismatic, and unique. On Duval Street, find rowdy bars beside high-end art galleries. Get a photo of the “southernmost point in the United States” landmark. When sunset rolls around, walk to Mallory Square for a sunset celebration like no other. Visit the Ernest Hemingway house and meet the author’s famous six-toed cats. After exploring the island, the beach awaits.

thingsToDo.name: Stroll Duval Street
thingsToDo.text: Walk Duval Street and experience Key West’s culture and nightlife—from the famous Sloppy Joe’s Bar to charming art galleries and drag shows—Duval Street offers a little something for everyone.

thingsToDo.name: Celebrate the Sunset at Mallory Square
thingsToDo.text: As the sun sets, Mallory Square comes alive with street performers and music.

thingsToDo.name: Key Lime Pie at Blue Heaven
thingsToDo.text: At Blue Heaven restaurant you can enjoy a delicious slice of key lime pie in the restaurant’s outdoor yard, where Key West’s chickens roam.

thingsToDo.name: Beaches and Reefs
thingsToDo.text: Bask on the sand at Fort Zachary Taylor Historic State Park or take a catamaran to a coral reef off the coast.

name: New York City
description: One of the greatest cities in the world, New York is always a whirlwind of activity, with famous sites at every turn and never enough time to see them all. Some people come here to enjoy the Broadway shows; others come specifically to shop and dine; and many come simply to see the sites: the Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building, Brooklyn Bridge, Central Park, historic neighborhoods, and numerous world famous museums.

thingsToDo.name: Statue of Liberty
thingsToDo.text: America's most iconic sight, the Statue of Liberty is at the top of every first-time visitor's list of things to do in New York. It was France's gift to America. Built in 1886, it remains a world symbol of freedom and is one of the top attractions in America.

thingsToDo.name: Central Park
thingsToDo.text: A walk, peddle, or carriage ride through the crisscrossing pathways of Central Park is a must-do on anyone's New York City itinerary. In winter, you can even lace up your skates and glide across Wollman Rink. This huge park in the city center, a half-mile wide and 2.5 miles long, is one of the things that makes New York such a beautiful and livable city.

thingsToDo.name: Rockefeller Center & Top of the Rock Observation Deck
thingsToDo.text: When it comes to New York attractions, Rockefeller Center is on almost all tourist's itineraries. This vast entertainment and shopping complex in the middle of Manhattan is home to NBC-TV and other media, but the centerpiece is the 70-story 30 Rockefeller Plaza, an Art Deco skyscraper that offers awesome views over Manhattan from the famous Top of the Rock Observation Deck.

thingsToDo.name: Broadway and the Theater District
thingsToDo.text: Attending a Broadway show is one of the top things to do in New York City. Considered the pinnacle of American theater, this is the place to see the latest shows and the long-running classics.

thingsToDo.name: Empire State Building
thingsToDo.text: The Empire State Building is one of New York's most famous landmark buildings and key tourist attractions. The 381-meter-tall, 102-storey building was the tallest in the world until the 1 World Trade Center tower rose higher, 41 years later. Topped with a mooring mast for airships, the Empire State Building immediately became a landmark and a symbol for NYC when it opened in 1931.

thingsToDo.name: Times Square
thingsToDo.text: Lined with huge, brilliantly lit billboards and screens, Times Square is the place to go in New York in the evening, but still exciting at any time of day. This is the location of New York's New Year's Eve Celebrations and the famous 'ball drop' at midnight, when the square and surrounding streets are filled with people.

thingsToDo.name: Bryant Park
thingsToDo.text: On a summer's day, it's hard to beat a leisurely afternoon at Bryant Park. The grounds feature monuments and gardens, and 'Le Carrousel,' a popular carousel. A games area makes available chess boards, checkers, and backgammon boards for a small fee.

name: Catskill
description: Bid adieu to the hustle and bustle and say hello to Catskill, NY, where you’ll find limitless acres of landscapes, ripe with opportunities for outdoor adventure and festivals and events that can rival any big-city lineup. Catskill is the perfect getaway from the city or for a week-long vacation with family or friends.

thingsToDo.name: Kaaterskill Falls
thingsToDo.text: Just 22 minutes outside the city of Catskill, Kaaterskill Falls is one of the most popular hikes in the area, mainly because it is a short hike to a huge, 260-foot (80 meter) payoff, divided over two drops. This is the highest two-tiered waterfall in the state of New York. Its upper tier measures an impressive 175 feet (54 meters), while its lower tier is 85 feet (26 meters) tall.

thingsToDo.name: Hunter Mountain
thingsToDo.text: Hunter Mountain is a true four-season resort, offering a wide variety of events, activities, and accommodations year-round, where the fun here doesn’t stop when the snow melts! Get away to the heart of the beautiful Northern Catksills and enjoy Hunter Mountain’s Scenic Skyride Chairlift, which brings you to the summit of Hunter Mountain.

thingsToDo.name: Greene County Council on the Arts
thingsToDo.text: If you want to know anything about art, go to Greene County Council on the Arts for shows, exhibitions, and information. A well-oiled machine so to speak, the county council runs this place efficiently and have been cultivating, curating, presenting and advocating for the arts in Greene County for over 40 years, which is a remarkable achievement. The council maintains an active gallery on Main Street in Catskill, NY, a popular children’s arts program, and join forces on a wide selection of installation projects, for professionals and amateur enthusiasts alike.

name: Niagara Falls
description: The Niagara Falls are among the most impressive and best-known falls in the world. They lie in the extreme northwest of New York State along the U.S./Canadian border, which is formed by the Niagara River. Here, masses of water from Lake Erie plunge over an almost 200-foot drop to flow into Lake Ontario, attracting more than 12 million visitors a year.

name: Honolulu
description: A town of rolling surf and seaside cocktail shacks that represents the cultural kingpin of Hawaii as a whole, this Polynesian-flavored American state capital rarely fails to impress.

thingsToDo.name: Hit the sands of Waikiki Beach
thingsToDo.text: It’s hardly surprising that world-famous Waikiki Beach once drew the kings and queens of the Hawaiian archipelago to its sands.

thingsToDo.name: Wax up the surf boards and hit the waves
thingsToDo.text: No trip to Hawaii’s fun-loving, surf-mad capital could possibly be complete without at least a mention of this most popular of local pastimes.

thingsToDo.name: Keep company with Hawaiian kings at the glorious ʻIolani Palace
thingsToDo.text: The ancestral home of the revered Kalakaua Dynasty sits nestled in the midst of the Honolulu downtown. Contrasting with the modern builds all around, this 19th-century palace oozes a Francophone, Italianate charm from each of its terraces and Baroque come classical nooks and crannies.

name: Maui
description: Whether you come to Maui for its natural beauty, stellar sunsets, prime whale watching or 81 gorgeous beaches, there’s never a lack of things to do on Maui.

thingsToDo.name: Witness a Haleakala sunrise
thingsToDo.text: The highest point on Maui is atop Haleakala, the largest dormant volcano in the world, which reaches an impressive 10,023 feet and attracts hundreds of thousands of visitors each year. While a 2 a.m. wake up call may not sound like most people’s idea of a relaxing vacation activity, it’s worth it.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the road to Hana
thingsToDo.text: A winding road of more than 600 turns and 50 one-lane bridges, the Road to Hana is unlike any other drive you’ll experience. Leading you through 68 miles of lush Maui rainforest, this is a drive that’s sure to surprise even the most avid nature-lovers. Enjoy hiking through bamboo forests, visiting organic fruit farms, standing in lava tubes, swimming in freshwater caves, frolicking in waterfalls, and discovering the true beauty of Hawaiian paradise.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Molokini Crater
thingsToDo.text: Located two miles off of Maui’s South shore, Molokini Crater is a natural crescent and Marine Life Conservation District frequented by snorkelers and scuba divers from around the world. With visibility that exceeds 180 feet on good days and thousands of tropical reef fish swimming below and alongside you, Molokini is a can’t miss for those of you planning on exploring Maui’s underwater life.

thingsToDo.name: Go whale watching
thingsToDo.text: If you’re in Maui between December and April, lucky you! Approximately 10,000 humpback whales swim from the Gulf of Alaska to Hawaii each year to birth and nurse their calves in the shallow, warm water before making the long journey back. The Auau Channel between Maui and Lana’i is one of the most popular spots to witness these majestic animals, which can be seen from shore, boat, kayak, outrigger canoe, stand up paddle board, helicopter and, for the lucky couple, even scuba diving.

name: Dallas
description: A well-rounded city growing out of the stark North Texas prairie, Dallas has a jumble of ultramodern skyscrapers, the largest arts district in the United States, museums of the highest quality and pulsating nightlife.

thingsToDo.name: Dealey Plaza
thingsToDo.text: In Dallas you can visit a place where the course of history was changed forever. The landmarks at Dealey Plaza, like the Texas School Book Depository, the Grassy Knoll and Elm Street as it bends down to the railroad tracks, would be unremarkable were it not for the assassination of John F. Kennedy on November 22, 1963.

thingsToDo.name: Arts District
thingsToDo.text: Dallas lays claim to the largest urban arts district in the United States, on 20 square blocks to the south-east of Uptown, and with a rare concentration of cultural attractions.

thingsToDo.name: Nasher Sculpture Center
thingsToDo.text: Raymond Nasher (1921-2007), the developer behind the NorthPark Center mall, was a voracious art collector, and together with his wife Patsy assembled a jaw-dropping sculpture collection.

thingsToDo.name: Reunion Tower
thingsToDo.text: One of the towers that make Dallas, Dallas arrived to the south of Dealey Plaza in 1978. Also known as The Ball, the 171-meter Reunion Tower is four narrow shafts (one cylindrical and thee rectangular) crowned with an openwork geodesic dome illuminated at night by 259 LEDs.

name: Austin
description: With everything from wild mountain ranges to hip and trendy bars, Austin is one of the most vibrant cities in Texas.

thingsToDo.name: Lady Bird Lake
thingsToDo.text: With glittering waters and tree-lined shores, Lady Bird Lake is one of the most beautiful attractions in Austin, and it can offer hours of entertainment for outdoor enthusiasts.

thingsToDo.name: Museum of the Weird
thingsToDo.text: With its eye-popping colors and brain-bending oddities, the Museum of the Weird is one of the most unique things to see in Austin. t’s the only place in the city where you can find shrunken heads next to melted wax figures next to gigantic statues of movie monsters.

thingsToDo.name: Downtown Austin
thingsToDo.text: With its gleaming buildings and waterfront views, Austin has one of the most recognizable skylines in the entire state of Texas. However, there are just as many fun things to see on the ground! Shops and restaurants line the sidewalks. Malls, museums, art galleries and performance theaters offer a fun night on the town.

thingsToDo.name: Austin Nature and Science Center
thingsToDo.text: You won’t want to miss the Austin Nature and Science Center. While it offers family-friendly fun that can be enjoyed by all ages, it holds a special kind of magic for children. Maybe it’s because of the wildlife center that houses everything from birds to bobcats. Maybe it’s because of the “dino pit” where little paleontologists can dig up their own rocks, fossils and gemstones. At this destination, you can enjoy education and entertainment all rolled into one, so it should please parents and kids alike.

name: Houston
description: Houston, named after former General Sam Houston who, in 1836, won the Battle of San Jacinto which gained Texas its independence from Mexico, is the fourth most populated city in North America and home to approximately two and a half million residents. It is a magnet for tourism, being closely linked with the Space Center Houston, and NASA’s astronaut training and flight control complex together with many other interesting attractions.

thingsToDo.name: Museum of Natural Science
thingsToDo.text: The Houston Museum of Natural Science (abbreviated as HMNS) has an amazing collection of mineral specimens, space station models, 60 large skeleton mounts – which include four Tyrannosaurus Rex and three large Quetzalcoatlus – a planetarium, and lots more to occupy the family for the day.

thingsToDo.name: Space Center Houston
thingsToDo.text: One of the city’s topmost attractions, the space center is home to more than 400 artifacts together with an abundance of both permanent and traveling exhibits as well as other displays relating to America’s awesome space flight programs.

thingsToDo.name: Downtown Aquarium
thingsToDo.text: This splendid six acre dining and entertainment complex was made even more amazing by the amalgamated redevelopment of two of Houston’s landmarks, the Central Waterworks Building and Fire Station No.1.

thingsToDo.name: Miller Outdoor Theatre
thingsToDo.text: This outstanding theater offers both culturally and artistically assorted daytime children’s programming as part of its free productions season as well as many other free plays, concerts, dances and shows to suit all ages.

name: Beijing
description: Behind the bustle and buzz of modernity, Beijing’s iconic destinations invite you to delve into this capital city’s amazing past. From the historic Forbidden City, and the awe-inspiring Great Wall, to the 100-acre Tiananmen Square, and the enchanting hutong alleys, you’re in for a cultural treat in Beijing. With opera and punk rock, sidewalk food vendors and elegant restaurants, Beijing fuses contradictions and contrasts into one remarkable experience.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Beijing Opera
thingsToDo.text: Enjoy the fascinating music, singing, costumes and performance of a traditional opera. Then try on a few opera costumes and make-up, too.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Forbidden City
thingsToDo.text: Visit the Forbidden City with a local guide and learn about the Imperial Palace which was home to 24 emperors from 1420 until 1924.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the silk factory
thingsToDo.text: From silkworms to cocoons, learn how silk is made and see beautiful silk bedding and garments.

thingsToDo.name: Head to the Great Wall, China
thingsToDo.text: Take a tour of one of the great wonders of the world as it winds up and down across varied terrains like a dragon.

name: Shanghai
description: The introduction to China's largest city often begins with a ride on the world's fastest passenger train, which symbolizes this rapidly growing destination. Now home to over 25 million people, this “Paris of the East” is prized for its retail therapy and Western-style entertainment, while giving a nod to its centuries-old history and traditions.

thingsToDo.name: Ride the Shanghai Maglev Train
thingsToDo.text: Take a ride on the world's fastest, most futuristic passenger train with a maximum cruising speed of 268 mph.

thingsToDo.name: Get away from the hustle-bustle
thingsToDo.text: Visit the Ming Dynasty-era Yu Garden and Old Bazaar Yuyuan Garden, a place of peace and comfort in the heart of bustling Shanghai.

thingsToDo.name: Visit a water village
thingsToDo.text: Take a tour of the village of Zhouzhuang, which is surrounded and divided by lakes and rivers, and dates back more than 900 years.

thingsToDo.name: Head to the French Concession
thingsToDo.text: For a taste of old Shanghai check out the French Concession, lined with old villas and lane houses from the early 1900s.

name: Xi'an
description: Located in central-northwest China, 3,000-year-old Xi'an was the capital for 13 Chinese dynasties and 73 emperors, and is the acknowledged root of Chinese civilization. Bearing witness to the great changes within the country, it’s today a treasure trove of history and culture. From the being the eastern terminal of the Silk Road, home to the famed Terracotta Warriors, museums, historical ruins, and cultural relics, Xi’an has a special place in your China itinerary.

thingsToDo.name: Make a trip to the Terracotta Warriors
thingsToDo.text: Discovered as recently as 1974, see the Terracotta Army of over 7,000 soldiers, horses and chariots that’s been guarding Emperor Qin's tomb since 210 BC.

thingsToDo.name: Bike or stroll along the ancient City Wall
thingsToDo.text: Get a great view of the city from the top of this his massive city wall that’s been guarding the inner city for over 700 years.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Shaanxi History Museum
thingsToDo.text: Discover more than 1,700,000 cultural relics, including exhibits of ancient living from 115,000 years ago.

thingsToDo.name: Take a tour of the Big Wild Goose Pagoda
thingsToDo.text: Located in the royal temple complex, it’s the earliest and largest square tower built of bricks during the Tang Dynasty.

name: Tokyo
description: Tokyo is a city that needs almost no introduction, having been featured in countless films, TV shows and music videos. An icon of popular culture, Tokyo is also a city that never sleeps, so you will never be short of things to do when you are in town.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Asakusa
thingsToDo.text: The Asakusa District of Tokyo is known for being the home of the Senso-ji temple which is also one of the top sights in the city. The temple is covered in gorgeous design elements and carvings, and visitors flock here to pray and drink in the serene and relaxed vibes.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the Imperial Palace
thingsToDo.text: One of the top spots in Tokyo for visitors is the Imperial Palace which is the home of the emperor and sprawls over 2,000,000 square meters. Located in the Marunouchi District close to central Tokyo Station, you need to book in advance if you want to visit.

thingsToDo.name: Watch a baseball game
thingsToDo.text: Many people don’t realize that Japanese locals love the sport of baseball, so if you are in Tokyo then it makes sense to also watch a game when you are in town. There are a number of different teams here such as the Tokyo Swallows and the Yomiuri Giants, and you can watch a game at a number of stadiums around the city.

thingsToDo.name: Go shopping in Akihabara
thingsToDo.text: The Akihabara District of Tokyo is located around Akihabara Station and is also called ‘Electric Town’ in English. It is known primarily for its quirky venues such as maid cafes and cosplay bars which many tourists want to visit as these kinds of attractions are unique to Japan and you can learn more about the otaku culture here.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the Sumo Museum
thingsToDo.text: When people think of Japan they often also think of its national sport of Sumo wrestling. With that in mind, if you want to learn more about this amazing sport, then you need to head to the Sumo Museum which is free to enter and will fill you in on all the history.

thingsToDo.name: Enjoy the Cherry Blossom Festival at Yasukuni Shrine
thingsToDo.text: Yasukuni Shrine is one of the top places to come if you are in Tokyo for the cherry blossom season from March to May. You can see cherry blossom trees in bloom all over the city but one of the best places to do so is at Yasukuni Shrine as this is also the home of the Sakura Festival and there are some 600 cherry trees here.

thingsToDo.name: Have a night out singing karaoke
thingsToDo.text: Everyone knows that Japan is famous for karaoke bars and with that in mind you should make sure to spend some time singing along to some of you favorite tunes.

thingsToDo.name: Visit a cat cafe
thingsToDo.text: Japan is now known for its unusual cafes and one of the most famous is the Cat Cafe in Nekorobi. f you love felines but don’t have your own pet, then you can come here and check out all the resident cats here as well as get a coffee or a bite to eat at the same time.

thingsToDo.name: Tour Ghibli Museum
thingsToDo.text: Anyone who is a fan of Japanese cartoons Spirited Away and Princess Mononoke should make sure to head to the Ghibli Museum as it was Studio Ghibli who produced these iconic animated films. You can walk around a number of galleries here and check out some of the original sketches from the animations and you can also see models of some of the characters from the films.

name: Kyoto
description: Japan is a land of dichotomy, always maintaining a balanced approach to modern advancement and tradition. Where other cities in Japan have technology, Kyoto has temples, reigning as the country’s cultural capital. Those who venture to Kyoto can expect magical sights of bamboo forests, ornate shrines and temples, impeccably dressed geishas, theatre performances, rambunctious monkeys, and blooming cherry trees when the season permits. Travelers can learn all about art, tea, Zen Buddhism, and other pillars of Japanese culture all within the borders of this easily-accessible city.

thingsToDo.name: Wander through the incredible Fushimi Inari-taisha Shrine
thingsToDo.text: Kyoto’s most iconic treasure, the Fushimi Inari-taisha Shrine is located at the end of a flamed colored walkway made up of thousands of traditional torii gates. Visitors can easily spend a day wandering through the trails surrounding the network of ornate shrines. Half way up the mountain, expect incredible views of Kyoto at the Yotsutsuji Intersection.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Kinkakuji Temple
thingsToDo.text: Amidst a placid lake and surrounded by trees is the golden Kinkakuji Temple, a Zen temple wrapped in gold leaf, with the top floor gilded both inside and out. It was originally built as a retirement home for a famous shogun, who sanctioned the building to become a temple after his death.

thingsToDo.name: Participate in a tea ceremony
thingsToDo.text: Though tea ceremonies, known as chado or sado, are available all throughout Japan, experiencing one in Kyoto is especially sacred due to its strong Zen Buddhist roots. During a tea ceremony, the cup of tea is prepared artfully and carefully before serving it.

thingsToDo.name: Enjoy a panoramic view of the city at the Kyoto Tower
thingsToDo.text: A modern structure in a city of temples, the Kyoto Tower is the tallest building in Kyoto. Visitors can view panoramic views of the city extending all the way to Osaka. On the platform, telescopes and LED touch screens highlight notable landmarks, so that you can put a name to what you’re seeing. Go at sunset for the best experience.

thingsToDo.name: Climb to the top of Mt. Kurama and relax in the hot springs
thingsToDo.text: About 20 kilometers from the center of Kyoto is Kurama, a quaint town known for its traditional hotels and baths. Travelers can hike to the top of Mt. Kurama to Kurama-dera, an ornate Buddhist temple just above town. Those who want to save their energy for later can even take a cable car halfway up. Past the temple is a steep hiking trail surrounded by old trees with outstretched roots where its common to see songbirds, deer, monkeys, and other wildlife.

thingsToDo.name: Enjoy the Kyoto International Manga Museum
thingsToDo.text: Japanese cartoonists have a unique style of drawing figures for their audience. Manga is created for adults and children alike, and is commonly seen all throughout Japanese pop culture – with a significant history that draws back to the late 19th century.

thingsToDo.name: Smell cherry blossoms at Maruyama Park
thingsToDo.text: Maruyama Park is Kyoto’s best place to view cherry blossoms. In the evening, the central weeping cherry tree is even lit up for a spectacular display. The magical thing about this park is that it has many varieties of cherry blossoms, so visitors can witness a range of color, size, and texture. Enjoy a cup of tea or warm meal under the trees and watch the cranes float by on the nearby pond.

name: Osaka
description: Osaka is one of the main cities in Japan after Tokyo and is located on the island of Honshu. It is not as traditional or picturesque as other spots in the country like Kyoto, but it is still well worth a visit if you are planning a tour of Japan. Many locals will tell you that Osaka is one of the most laid back cities in the country and the people here are known for their warm hospitality, which means that you will have the chance to learn all about Japanese culture here.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Osaka-jo
thingsToDo.text: Osaka Castle dates from 1583 when it was first built using 100,000 workers to get the finished building. As with many castles in Japan however, it was destroyed and the structure that stands now was built in 1931 and has also been renovated over the years. Despite the fact that the castle is no longer the original, it is still one of the most impressive buildings in Osaka and is located in the middle of a leafy park and is encircled by a charming moat.

thingsToDo.name: Tour Kamigata Ukiyoe Museum
thingsToDo.text: If you want to learn more about traditional art in Osaka then consider a trip to Kamigata Ukiyoe Museum where you can learn all about the art of ukiyoe which is a kind of Japanese print. The prints are made using blocks of wood and the museum itself is styled on a traditional Japanese house.

thingsToDo.name: Explore Sumiyoshi Shrine
thingsToDo.text: Sumiyoshi Shrine has the claim to fame of being one of the oldest Shinto shrines not only in Osaka but also in wider Japan. The shrine was built over 1,800 years ago and it is said to be one of the prettiest Shinto shrines of its kind thanks to its ornate architecture and dainty design features.

thingsToDo.name: Go out in Dotonbori
thingsToDo.text: Dotonbori is known is Osaka as the place to come if you want to go out and enjoy the best of the city. This part of Osaka is the central hub of bars, restaurants and cafes, and you can come here in the evening to enjoy the relaxed atmosphere. Many of the cafes and restaurants here also have their own roof terraces and this means that you can sit out, listen to some live music and look out across twinkling Osaka at the same time.

thingsToDo.name: Try the local food
thingsToDo.text: Osaka is known in Japan for being something of a foodie paradise so if you like to eat then you have come to the right place! Some of the highlights here include the Okonomiyaki which is a kind of pancake made from shredded cabbage which is loaded with a range of toppings, as well as battera which is a style of sushi which features mackerel compressed with rice in a wooden box.

thingsToDo.name: Ride the Tempozan Ferris Wheel
thingsToDo.text: The Tempozan Ferris Wheel is one of the most iconic sights in Osaka and is located on the edge of the scenic Osaka Bay. At one time this would have been the tallest Ferris wheel of its kind in the world and the main attraction here is the chance to take a spin on the wheel and check out the pretty sights across the city.

name: Bangkok
description: Welcome to Bangkok—the sprawling, vibrant capital city of the Kingdom of Thailand. Here action and adventure await you at every turn. Whether you take a tuk tuk across town or the longtail boat through the floating market. Bathe and feed Asian elephants or marvel at golden hued temples and palaces. Indulge in local dishes at the night market or haute cuisine at rooftop restaurants, Bangkok is bustling with activity by day and night.

thingsToDo.name: Check out the Floating Market
thingsToDo.text: Ride a boat to this Bangkok market, where vendor boats sell everything from fresh fruits and flowers to clothing and souvenirs.

thingsToDo.name: Explore Bangkok's Wat Pho temple
thingsToDo.text: Immerse yourself in the ancient past and marvel at the famed golden Reclining Buddha.

thingsToDo.name: Get a bargain at the night market
thingsToDo.text: Shop, eat, drink, and have fun at the Suan Lum Night Bazaar, which boasts more than 2,000 stalls.

thingsToDo.name: Experience the nightlife
thingsToDo.text: From swanky rooftop bars and lively nightclubs to hip cocktail bars, no visit to Bangkok would be complete without a glimpse of its famous nightlife.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the Grand Place
thingsToDo.text: With its beautiful architecture and intricate detail, it’s been the home of the Thai King, the Royal court and the government for 150 years.

name: Chiang Mai
description: Chiang Mai blends ancient traditions with modern design and cuisine. Those with an interest in Buddhist practice can join the locals as they give alms to the temple monks or visit the International Buddhist Center at Wat Phra That Doi Suthep with its chanting and meditation services. For a more rustic temple experience, journey to the forest temple of Wat Umong. Then, browse the colorful Chiang Mai Night Bazaar. Take a walk on the wild side at the Elephant Nature Park.

thingsToDo.name: Browse the Chiang Mai Night Bazaar
thingsToDo.text: Search for the perfect souvenir at this bustling night bazaar that runs from sundown until late into the night.

thingsToDo.name: Go on a Retreat at the International Buddhist Centre
thingsToDo.text: Visit the Wat Phra That Doi Suthep and marvel at the temple’s golden spires, or delve more deeply into Buddhist ways with a retreat that includes lunch with the monks, meditation, chanting, and discussions.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Elephants at the Elephant Nature Park
thingsToDo.text: Support the work at the Elephant Nature Park, an elephant rescue and rehabilitation center.

thingsToDo.name: Choose Your Temple
thingsToDo.text: There are over 300 temples across the city. Wat Chedi Luang is home to the revered Emerald Buddha, and Wat Phra Singh is resplendent with its lavish mosaics.

thingsToDo.name: Check out the Art Scene
thingsToDo.text: Chiang Mai boasts a bustling creative scene with modern day galleries and cosmopolitan restaurants.

name: Rio de Janeiro
description: Striking coastlines and exotic forests, thriving nightlife and mesmerizing samba schools – these are just some of the unique elements of Rio de Janeiro, a city with a startling identity unlike any other in the world.

thingsToDo.name: Museum of Tomorrow
thingsToDo.text: One of the 2016 Olympics’ most successful legacies, this groundbreaking science museum poses big questions about mankind’s future, inside an extraordinary neo-futurist building.

thingsToDo.name: Christ the Redeemer
thingsToDo.text: You’ll catch glimpses of this 98-feet-tall figure all around Rio, but don’t miss out on ascending Mount Corcovado to admire the iconic statue up-close.

thingsToDo.name: Take the gondola up Sugarloaf Mountain
thingsToDo.text: Sugarloaf Mountain is the large peak you’ll see in just about every photo of Rio de Janeiro, and taking the gondola to the top is one of the best attractions in Rio de Janeiro. Once at the top, you can wander around and enjoy the views and even a meal or drink

thingsToDo.name: Copacabana Beach
thingsToDo.text: It’s the most famous beach in the world and a trip to Rio wouldn’t be complete without spending at day at Copacabana. This four km iconic beach is filled with energy and excitement. Vendors and restaurants line the sand and a wide paved pathway along the road makes for an easy stroll.

thingsToDo.name: Helicopter Scenic Flight
thingsToDo.text: If there is one city you should do a scenic flight in this world, it is Rio. Rio’s landscape is spectacular with huge mountains framing the city. With a blend of urban sprawl, colourful hillside favelas, jungle, ocean, and beaches, this is one of the most beautiful cities on earth and a helicopter tour lets you truly take in the scope and scale of Rio’s landscape.

name: Sao Paulo
description: The largest city in Brazil, Sao Paulo (or Sampa as it is also often called), offers an intense cultural experience. Tropical plants, charismatic people, and lively, bright colors, sounds and scents surround every traveler here, from the moment they step from the plane. It is a melting pot city, and has large, integrated populations of Italian and Japanese cultures among others. This fusion of culture has created beautiful combination art, culinary scene, and music that are well worth exploring.

thingsToDo.name: Sao Paulo Cathedral
thingsToDo.text: This is the largest church in the city (but not the state) of Sao Paulo, and can seat 8,000 people. It is a large-domed 20th century cathedral of the neo-gothic style, and was constructed using over 800 tons of marble.

thingsToDo.name: Museu do Futebol
thingsToDo.text: The ultimate museum for football (soccer) fans, the Museu do Futebol offers both traditional exhibits as well as video and interactive displays. From information on famous players and famous games to basic instruction on how the game is played, the museum has things for people at every level of fandom, and even those considering becoming fans.

thingsToDo.name: Avenida Paulista
thingsToDo.text: The 2.8 km (1.7 miles) long Paulista Avenue was originally a residential street filled with large, ornate mansions belonging to coffee barons. Many of these were torn down in the 1950’s, and replaced with large, multi-story buildings. It remains a center of luxury and business, and is much like Park Avenue Meets Wall Street in New York City. Today, many of Sao Paulo’s major banks make their headquarters here, in addition to some of the finest prep schools in the country.

thingsToDo.name: Ibirapuera Park
thingsToDo.text: Sampa’s answer to Central Park, Ibirapuera Park serves as a major recreational site and is one of the main tourist attractions in Sao Paulo. It has paths for walking and jogging, bikeways, woods, lakes, sport courts and areas for relaxation that attract city residents of all ages.

name: Salvador
description: Located in the great state of Bahia, Salvador is a city filled with culture, history, and food. If you’re planning a trip there, you’re in luck; there are so many fun things to do in Salvador, no matter what type of traveler you are.

thingsToDo.name: Farol da Barra Beach
